item.title: Mistral AI buys Koyeb in first acquisition to back its cloud ambitions
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Mistral AI has agreed to buy Koyeb, a Paris-based startup that simplifies AI app deployment at scale and manages the infrastructure behind it.

item.title: SpendRule raises $2M, emerges from stealth to help hospitals track spending
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: SpendRule, launched last summer, is an AI-powered platform that helps healthcare systems track their spending.

item.title: Just 8 months in, India’s vibe-coding startup Emergent claims ARR of over $100M
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh, Ivan Mehta
item.description: Indian vibe-coding platform Emergent was launched just eight months ago, and it now says it's generating annual recurring revenue of more than $100 million, thanks to surging demand by small businesses and non-technical users.

item.title: African defensetech Terra Industries, founded by two Gen Zers, raises additional $22M in a month
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Terra Industries, the African defense company, announced Monday that it had secured an additional $22 million in funding to further expand the business.

item.title: As AI data centers hit power limits, Peak XV backs Indian startup C2i to fix the bottleneck
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: C2i has raised $15 million as it tests a grid-to-GPU approach to reducing power losses in AI data centers.

item.title: Blackstone backs Neysa in up to $1.2B financing as India pushes to build domestic AI infrastructure
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Neysa is targeting deployments of more than 20,000 GPUs over time as demand for local AI compute accelerates.

item.title: OpenClaw creator Peter Steinberger joins OpenAI
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: OpenAI said OpenClaw will live on as an open source project.

item.title: What the Epstein files reveal about EV startups and Silicon Valley
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Will the Epstein revelations lead to broader fallout in Silicon Valley?

item.title: How to get into a16z’s super-competitive Speedrun startup accelerator program
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: TechCrunch spoke to a16z partner Joshua Lu for some tips on standing out for the Speedrun program.

item.title: Is safety ‘dead’ at xAI?
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Elon Musk is “actively” working to make xAI’s Grok chatbot “more unhinged," according to a former employee.

item.title: In a changed VC landscape, this exec is doubling down on overlooked founders
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: As much of Silicon Valley chases mega-rounds and buzzy AI deals, Stacy Brown-Philpot is running Cherryrock Capital like a throwback to venture capital's earlier days.

item.title: ‘Clueless’ -inspired app Alta partners with brand Public School to start integrating styling tools into websites
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: This week, Alta unveiled its first integration collaboration, teaming up with Public School, a storied New York City brand.

item.title: India doubles down on state-backed venture capital, approving $1.1B fund
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: India’s $1.1 billion fund-of-funds will invest through private VCs to support deep tech and manufacturing startups.

item.title: Why top talent is walking away from OpenAI and xAI
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: AI companies have been hemorrhaging talent the past few weeks. Half of xAI’s founding team has left the company — some on their own, others through “restructuring” — while OpenAI is facing its own shakeups, from the disbanding of its mission alignment team to the firing of a policy exec who opposed its “adult mode” feature.  Watch as TechCrunch’s Equity podcast hosts Kirsten Korosec, Anthony […]

item.title: AI burnout, billion-dollar bets, and Silicon Valley’s Epstein problem
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha, Kirsten Korosec, Sean O'Kane, Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: AI companies have been hemorrhaging talent the past few weeks. Half of xAI’s founding team has left the company — some on their own, others through “restructuring” — while OpenAI is facing its own shakeups, from the disbanding of its mission alignment team to the firing of a policy exec who opposed its “adult mode” feature.  On this episode of TechCrunch’s Equity podcast, hosts Kirsten […]

item.title: Score, the dating app for people with good credit, is back
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Two years ago, a controversial dating app was launched and quickly shuttered: for people with good-to-excellent credit. Now, the founder is relaunching it, open to anyone.

item.title: Fusion startup Helion hits blistering temps as it races toward 2028 deadline
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Helion's Polaris device hit 150 million degrees C recently, a milestone that nudges the company toward its commercial power plant that will sell electricity to Microsoft.

item.title: Didero lands $30M to put manufacturing procurement on ‘agentic’ autopilot
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Didero functions as an agentic AI layer that sits on top of a company’s existing ERP, acting as a coordinator that reads incoming communications and automatically executes the necessary updates and tasks.

item.title: Eclipse backs all-EV marketplace Ever in $31M funding round
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The San Francisco-based startup says its AI-first approach has allowed it to scale faster.

item.title: AI inference startup Modal Labs in talks to raise at $2.5B valuation, sources say
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: General Catalyst is in talks to lead the round for the four-year-old startup, according to our sources.
